route_spec: List = []¶
scheema_constructor(output_schema: Type[Schema] | None = None, input_schema: Type[Schema] | None = None, model: DeclarativeBase | None = None, group_tag: str | None = None, handler: Callable | None = None, authentication: Callable | None = None, **kwargs) → Callable[source]¶

Decorator to specify OpenAPI metadata for an endpoint, along with schema information for the input and output. If supplied, it also handles

Parameters:

  • output_schema (Optional[Type[Schema]], optional) – Output schema. Defaults to None.

  • input_schema (Optional[Type[Schema]], optional) – Input schema. Defaults to None.

  • model (Optional[DeclarativeBase], optional) – Database model. Defaults to None.

  • group_tag (Optional[str], optional) – Group name. Defaults to None.

  • handler (Optional[Callable], optional) – Handler function. Defaults to None.

  • authentication (Optional[Callable], optional) – Authentication function. Defaults to None.

  • kwargs (dict) – Dictionary of keyword arguments.

Returns:

The decorated function.

Return type:

Callable

flask_scheema.utilities module¶

class flask_scheema.utilities.AttributeInitializerMixin(app: Flask, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Mixin class to initialise class attributes from the Flask app config and kwargs.

flask_scheema.utilities.extract_relationships(model, randomise=True)[source]¶

Extract relationships from a SQLAlchemy model, if randomise is True, the order of the relationships will be randomised.

flask_scheema.utilities.extract_sqlalchemy_columns(model, randomise=True)[source]¶

Extract column names from a SQLAlchemy model, if randomise is True, the order of the columns will be randomised.

Parameters:

  • model (SQLAlchemy model) – SQLAlchemy model to extract columns from.

  • randomise (bool, optional) – Whether to randomise the order of the columns. Defaults to True.

Returns:

List of column names.

Return type:

List[str]

flask_scheema.utilities.find_child_from_parent_dir(parent, child, current_dir='/home/lewis/PycharmProjects/flask-scheema/docs')[source]¶

Recursively finds the path to the child directory in the parent directory.

Parameters:

  • parent – The path to the parent directory.

  • child – The name of the child directory.

  • current_dir – The current directory to start the search from.

Returns:

The path to the child directory, or None if the child directory is not found.

flask_scheema.utilities.find_root(path: str, search: str) → str[source]¶

Recursively finds the path to the child directory in the parent directory.

Parameters:

  • path (str) – The path to the parent directory.

  • search (str) – The name of the child directory.

Returns:

The path to the child directory, or None if the child directory is not found.

flask_scheema.utilities.get_config_or_model_meta(key: str, model: DeclarativeBase | None = None, output_schema: Schema | None = None, input_schema: Schema | None = None, default=None) → Any[source]¶

Used to get either the flask config or the Meta attribute from the model, or schemas.

Parameters:

  • key (str) – The key to get.

  • model (DeclarativeBase) – The model to get the key from.

  • output_schema (Schema) – The output schema to get the key from.

  • input_schema (Schema) – The input schema to get the key from.

  • default (Any) – The default value to return if the key is not found.

Returns:

The value of the key.

Return type:

Any
